alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Western Chesterfield (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 4:27PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Chesterfield, northwestern Dinwiddie and southeastern Amelia Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 427 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Scotts Fork, or near Amelia Courthouse, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Locations impacted include... Moseley, Mannboro, Chester, Sutherland, Scotts Fork, Winterpock, Ammon, Center Star, Church Road, Skinquarter, Beach, Five Forks, Walkers and Ford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Western Chesterfield
